member.param: The text to be displayed.
The font to be used.
The source rectangle, typically taken from the "parent" object of this Annotation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.BoxAnnotation.CornerExtent
member.summary: Corner size of the bounding rectangle for this Annotation.

remarks.p: CornerExtent is expressed as a percent of the length of each side; the corner will begin at this percentage length. For example, a value of 100 will result in no corner, whereas a value of 50 will appear circular. Values outside the range of 50-100 will produce unusual shapes.

member.summary: The value to be pointed at by this gauge marker.

remarks.p: The Type of this property varies based on the Scale of the parent gauge and its sections. On gauges with numeric scales, this property should be set to a System.Double. On gauges with time scales, this property should be set to a System.DateTime.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeMarker.ValueString
member.summary: Proxy property used to aid serialization of the Value property. Please do not use.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeMarker.Precision
member.summary: Precision used for this marker to point out values. Enable this marker to "snap to" distinct values on the parent gauge by setting this property to a non-zero value.

remarks.p: The functionality provided through this property is that of a gauge which only measures in distinct increments. This reduces ambiguity in reading the gauge, and also prevents the marker from "twitching" when the input value is changing rapidly in very small increments.

For example, if a gauge is set to display the CPU usage every 100 milliseconds (WinGauge), the marker will appear to shake rapidly around one value when the computer is idle. Set the Precision property to .5 so changes of less than .5 will not be displayed.
More examples: If this property is set to .5, a Value of 23.3 will be rounded to 20.5. If this property is set to 2.0, a Value of 23.3 will be rounded to 24.0.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeMarker.PrecisionString
member.summary: Proxy property used to aid serialization of the Precision property. Please do not use.

member.summary: Determines how many labels are rendered in the scale. This value is expressed as a multiple of the scale's Axis TickmarkInterval.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleLabelsAppearance.PostInitial
member.summary: Determines when label rendering begins in the scale. This value is added to the scale's Axis StartValue, and labels begin rendering at that sum.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleLabelsAppearance.PreTerminal
member.summary: Determines when label rendering ends in the scale. This value is subtracted from the scale's Axis's EndValue, and labels stop rendering at that value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleLabelsAppearance.Extent
member.summary: Extent of the center point of each label, expressed as a percentage of the size of the gauge.

remarks.p: For radial gauges, this value is expressed a percentage of the dial radius. For linear gauges, this value is expressed as a percentage of the width (for vertically oriented gauges) or the height (for horizontally oriented gauges).

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleLabelsAppearance.EqualFontScaling
member.summary: Scales the labels down to a single font size.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.LinearGaugeBarMarker.SegmentSpan
member.summary: Span of each segment in this bar marker. Set to a value less than 100 to break bars into segments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.LinearGaugeBarMarker.StartExtent
member.summary: Extent of the origin of this marker. For horizontally oriented gauges, this is expressed as a percentage of the gauge width, and is measured from the left side of the gauge. For vertically oriented gauges, this is expressed as a percentage of the gauge height, and is measured from the bottom of the gauge.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.LinearGaugeBarMarker.OuterExtent
member.summary: Extent of the outer end of this marker. For horizontally oriented gauges, this is expressed as a percentage of the gauge height, and is measured from the bottom of the gauge. For vertically oriented gauges, this is expressed as a percentage of the gauge width, and is measured from the left of the gauge.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.LinearGaugeBarMarker.InnerExtent
member.summary: Extent of the inner end of this marker. For horizontally oriented gauges, this is expressed as a percentage of the gauge height, and is measured from the bottom of the gauge. For vertically oriented gauges, this is expressed as a percentage of the gauge width, and is measured from the left of the gauge.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.LinearGaugeBarMarker.BulbSpan
member.summary: Span of a thermometer-style bulb shape to be rendered at the start of this marker. To enable a bulb shape, set this property to a non-zero value greater than the difference of OuterExtent and InnerExtent.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.LinearGaugeBarMarker.Background
member.summary: Properties which affect a background shape to be rendered behind the bar marker. This background shape will be seen extending from the value of the bar marker to the end of the gauge.

member.summary: Sets the Gauge Component in context for this object.
member.param: The Gauge Component to be used for this object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.Frequency
member.summary: How often to render a tickmark, expressed as a multiple of the current section's Scale's TickmarkInterval.

remarks.p: If the scale of the current section goes from 0 to 100 and has a TickmarkInterval of 10, then a TickmarkAppearance with a Frequency of 1 will render at multiples of 10; a TickmarkAppearance with a Frequency of .5 will render at multiples of 5; and a TickmarkAppearance with a Frequency of 2 will render at multiples of 20.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.PostInitial
member.summary: A number, added to the current section's scale's start value, at which tickmark rendering should begin.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.PreTerminal
member.summary: A number, subtracted from the current section's scale's end value, at which tickmark rendering should end.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.Visible
member.summary: Whether or not tickmarks are visible. Setting this value to false disables rendering for these tickmarks.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.StartExtent
member.summary: Location at which each tickmark should be started. This value is expressed as a percentage of the entire extent of the gauge; for radial gauges this is a percent of the radius, whereas with linear gauges this is a percent of the height or width.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.EndExtent
member.summary: Location at which each tickmark should be ended. This value is expressed as a percentage of the entire extent of the gauge; for radial gauges this is a percent of the radius, whereas with linear gauges this is a percent of the height or width.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.StrokeElement
member.summary: StrokeElement defining the Pen used to outline each tickmark.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.BrushElement
member.summary: BrushElement defining how tickmarks are painted.

remarks.p: Note that if StartWidth and EndWidth are 1, the BrushElement will not be used, since there is no area to fill/paint. In this scenario, use the StrokeElement to define tickmark color.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.GaugeScaleTickmarkAppearance.BrushElements
member.summary: Proxy member used only for serialization of the BrushElement property. Please do not use.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.BrushElement.RelativeClipBounds
member.summary: Bounds of a clipping rectangle for this BrushElement.

remarks.p: These bounds are relative to the top-left of the BrushElement's target rectangle. Dimensions can be specified in pixels or as a percentage of the target rectangle. Use the RelativeClipBoundsMeasure property to set the coordinate system being used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.BrushElement.RelativeClipBoundsMeasure
member.summary: Measurement unit to use for the RelativeClipBounds property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.BrushElement.RelativeBounds
member.summary: A rectangle used to alter the location or size of this BrushElement, relative to any target rectangles which it fills.

remarks.p: The top and left coordinates of fills, as well as their sizes can be offset using this property. Dimensions can be specified in pixels or as a percentage of the target rectangle. Use the RelativeBoundsMeasure property to set the coordinate system being used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.BrushElement.RelativeBoundsMeasure
member.summary: Measurement unit to use for the RelativeBounds property.

member.summary: Ending angle of the dial.

member.summary: Base shape for the dial.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.DialAppearance.Expansion
member.summary: Expansion around center point. Affects dials which sweep fewer than 360 degrees.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.DialAppearance.CornerSplineTension
member.summary: Spline tension for rounded corners on gauges which sweep fewer than 360 degrees, and have a CornerExtent less than 100.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.DialAppearance.CornerExtent
member.summary: Corner size used when rendering corners on the dial shape.

remarks.p: CornerExtent is expressed as a percent of the length of each side, or as a percent of the sweep angle before each corner. The corner will begin at this percentage length. Sensible values are between 50 and 100.

This property wil have a different effects under different circumstances in rendering the dial. For rectangular dials, the CornerExtent simply applies to the four corners of the rectangle. For elliptical dials, no corners will be rendered if the dial sweeps 360 degrees or more.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.DialAppearance.InnerExtent
member.summary: Inner radius of the dial, expressed as a percentage of the overall radius.

remarks.p: For elliptical dials, a positive value for this property will result in a doughnut shape for the dial; a negative value for this property will also create a "seashell" shape if the dial sweeps less than 360 degrees.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.DialAppearance.Shadow
member.summary: Settings used to render a shadow under the dial.

member.summary: Color of the stroke.

remarks.p: If the StrokeElement.BrushElement property is set to a non-null value, this property will be ignored in favor of that Brush.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.StrokeElement.Alignment
member.summary: Alignment of the stroke.

remarks.p: This property corresponds directly with the System.Drawing.Pen.Alignment property. Thus, the limitations of the System.Drawing.Pen.Alignment property are also seen here; only Inset and Center values are respected. For more information, please refer to the MSDN documentation for that property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.StrokeElement.BrushElement
member.summary: BrushElement used to fill the outline. If the thickness of the stroke is greater than one, the BrushElement can be seen if it is being used.

remarks.p: This property is not required. To create a simple solid-color stroke, just set the StrokeElement.Color property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.StrokeElement.BrushElements
member.summary: Proxy member used only for serialization of the BrushElement property. Please do not use.

member.name: P:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.StrokeElement.DashStyle
member.summary: The drawing style of the pen. This property corresponds directly with the System.Drawing.Pen.DashStyle property.

remarks.p: Custom DashStyles are not currently supported.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.Axis.Map(System.Object,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds the numeric location of a value on this axis, relative to given start and end numeric values.
member.param: The value to find on this axis.
The numeric minimum relative to which the value will be mapped.
The numeric maximum relative to which the value will be mapped.
member.returns: The numeric location of a value on this axis, relative to mapMinimum and mapMaximum.

remarks.p: The mapMinimum and mapMaximum parameters are typically pixel or degree values. For example, when mapping on a horizontal linear gauge, mapMinimum would be the leftmost pixel X-coordinate on the axis, whereas mapMaximum would be the rightmost pixel X-coordinate. Or, on a radial gauge, mapMinimum would be the start angle of the gauge, whereas mapMaximum would be the end angle of the same gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.Axis.MapInverse(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns the value found at a given location on the axis.
member.param: The location which would be the result of mapping a value on this axis.
The numeric minimum relative to which the value will be mapped.
The numeric maximum relative to which the value will be mapped.
member.returns: The value which would be mapped at the given location.

member.name: M:Infragistics.UltraGauge.Resources.Geometry.EllipsePointAlternate(System.Double,System.Double,System.Drawing.Point,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Alternate formula for finding a point on an ellipse.
member.param: The angle, expressed in radians, at which to find a point on the ellipse circumference.
The eccentricity of the ellipse. Use the Geometry.Eccentricity function.
The center of the ellipse.
One half of the ellipse's height.

The extent at which to find the point. A value of 100 will return a point on the Ellipse circumference. Less than 100 will return a point inside the ellipse, and greater than 100 will return a point outside the ellipse.
member.returns: The point on the ellipse taken from the given parameters.

remarks.p: Alternate formula is Geometry.PointOnEllipse. This function returns angular values which are not necessarily evenly distributed along the circumference of the ellipse.
